cont.entity_a: Lens has spots that appear in pictures, possibly inside the lens.
Flash had issues but was fixed after cleaning.
Camera body has a good feel.
cont.entity_b: Rubber-coated aluminum chassis feels better than competitors.

cont.entity_a: Battery lasts long, but a second battery was purchased. Battery life is excellent.
Produces great pictures even after almost 10 years. Low noise performance is above average at ISO1600.
cont.entity_b: Excellent picture quality. Minor complaints about color accuracy.

cont.entity_a: Latency is subsecond, suitable for capturing action shots.
Does not take video.
Algorithms in controls are advanced.
Ease of use allows more focus on creating photos. Easy to use with intuitive system controls.
cont.entity_b: E-300 is intuitive and easy to use. Easy to learn and operate. Menus are easy to navigate.
Built tough and feels great to hold.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with older Canon lenses.
Shutter speed is impressive.
Cord port for laptop connection is broken.
Switch to turn on the camera is awkwardly placed.
cont.entity_b: Film card door was fixed with velcro and superglue.

cont.entity_a: Lacks true spot metering and has a loud mirror slap.
8 megapixel resolution allows for large prints.
cont.entity_b: Good price for an 8mp digital SLR.

Build.comm: Solid build with a good grip.

cont.entity_a: Autofocus is fast and accurate.

cont.entity_b: Recommended for novices and pros alike.

cont.entity_a: No support for 64-bit operating systems.
File naming system does not prevent overwriting.
Price is reasonable for its capabilities.
cont.entity_b: Good price for an 8mp digital SLR.

cont.entity_a: Lens bundled is adequate but upgrading is recommended.

cont.entity_b: Came with a full array of accessories.
Focal plane dust removal system is unmatched by competitors.
Kodak KAF8300CE CCD is used for high performance.
Viewfinder is dim, focusing can be tricky.
Automatic settings result in poorly lit and blurry pictures.
